evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief and Request for Class Action
evidence.text: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF OKLAHOMA 1. D.G., by Next Friend G. Gail Stricklin; ) FILED FEB 13 2008 ... COMPLAINT FOR INJUNCTIVE AND DECLARATORY RELIEF AND REQUEST FOR CLASS ACTION

extracted.value: The Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief and Request for Class Action was filed by nine minor plaintiffs, represented by their next friends (including attorneys from Kaye Scholer LLP, Children's Rights, and other law firms), on February 13, 2008. The complaint alleges systemic failures in Oklahoma's foster care system, including inadequate foster home placements, excessive caseloads for caseworkers, and inadequate monitoring of children's safety, and requests declaratory and injunctive relief to stop these violations.

evidence.text: 02/13/2008 4  MOTION to Certify Class, MOTION for Appointment of Counsel and Brief in Support Thereof by J.P., R.J., G.C., K.T., D.G., C.S., J.B., A.P., J.A. (With attachments) (Dorwart, Frederic) (Entered: 02/13/2008)

extracted.value: The Motion to Certify Class and Appointment of Counsel was filed by the plaintiffs on February 13, 2008, requesting the court to certify the case as a class action and appoint counsel. This motion was granted on February 14, 2008, with the court ordering the admission of multiple attorneys pro hac vice.

evidence.text: 04/11/2008 58  MOTION to Dismiss and Brief in Support by C Brad Henry (Boughton, Scott) (Entered: 04/11/2008)

extracted.value: The Motion to Dismiss was filed by defendants (C. Brad Henry and others) on April 11, 2008, requesting the court to dismiss the complaint for lack of subject matter jurisdiction. This motion was later supplemented with additional briefs and arguments.

evidence.text: 03/25/2008 43  MOTION to Compel the Production of Documents and Brief in Support Thereof by JP, RJ, GC, KT, DG, CS, JB, AP, JA (With attachments) (Dorwart, Frederic) Modified on 3/27/2008 this is a multi-part motion, but only 1 part was filed; Clerk's Office filed 2nd part (Motion for Protective Order) as 45

04/02/2008 53  ORDER by Magistrate Judge Frank H McCarthy ; granting 43 Motion to Compel; denying 45 Motion for Protective Order; denying 46 Motion to Accelerate/Extend/Reset Hearing(s)/Deadline(s) (jcm, Dpty Clk) (Entered: 04/02/2008)

extracted.value: The Motion for Protective Order was filed by plaintiffs on March 25, 2008, seeking to compel document production and establish confidentiality agreements. This motion was granted in part on April 2, 2008, with the court ordering production of documents and denying the protective order request.

evidence.text: 06/19/2009 281 NOTICE OF APPEAL to Circuit Court (filed per 10th Circuit Order dated 6/19/09) by Richard L DeVaughn, Ronald L Mercer, Jay Dee Chase, Patrice Dills Douglas, Michael L Peck, Garoldine Webb, Aneta F Wilkinson, George E Young, Sr, Howard H Hendrick (s−srb, Dpty Clk). (Entered: 06/19/2009)

extracted.value: The Notice of Appeal was filed by the defendants on June 19, 2009, requesting the court to appeal the district court's decision to the Tenth Circuit Court of Appeals. This filing was followed by the assignment of case number 09-5093.

evidence.text: 04/15/2010 358 Unopposed MOTION to Seal Document Dkt 357, OKDHS Defendants' Unredacted First Amended Answer (Re: 357 SEALED UNREDACTED VERSION of Dkt # 356 per Local Rule 5.3(b)by Steven Dow, Richard L DeVaughn, Ronald L Mercer, Jay Dee Chase, Michael L Peck, Garoldine Webb, Aneta F Wilkinson, George E Young, Sr, Howard H Hendrick (With attachments) (Bingham, Donald) Modified on 4/16/2010 to add link to Doc # 357 (tjc, Dpty Clk). (Entered: 04/15/2010)

extracted.value: The Unopposed MOTION to Seal Document was filed by the plaintiffs on April 15, 2010, seeking to seal the First Amended Answer (Document #357). This motion was granted on April 16, 2010.

evidence.text: 04/27/2010 371 Unopposed MOTION to Seal Document by JP, RJ, GC, KT, JB, AP, JA (Dorwart, Frederic) (Entered: 04/27/2010)

extracted.value: The Unopposed MOTION to Seal Document was filed by the plaintiffs on April 27, 2010, seeking to seal the Motion to Compel (Document #348). This motion was granted on April 28, 2010.

evidence.text: 12/13/2010 448 Sixth MOTION to Compel by AP, GC, JA, JB, JP, KT, RJ (With attachments) (Dorwart, Frederic) (Entered: 12/13/2010)

extracted.value: The Sixth MOTION to Compel was filed by the plaintiffs on December 13, 2010, seeking to compel the defendants to provide additional discovery responses. This motion was later granted by the court on February 11, 2011.

evidence.text: 06/24/2011 524 Unopposed MOTION to Seal Document by Jay Dee Chase, Richard L DeVaughn, Steven Dow, Howard H Hendrick, Ronald L Mercer, Michael L Peck, Ann M Roberts, Linda English Weeks, Aneta F Wilkinson, George E Young, Sr (Theban, Stephanie) (Entered: 06/24/2011)

extracted.value: The Unopposed MOTION to Seal Document was filed by the defendants on June 24, 2011, seeking to seal a motion related to expert witnesses and discovery. This motion was granted on June 24, 2011.

evidence.text: 07/15/2011 561 MOTION for Summary Judgment by Jay Dee Chase, Richard L DeVaughn, Steven Dow, Howard H Hendrick, Michael L Peck, Ann M Roberts, Linda English Weeks, Aneta F Wilkinson, George E Young, Sr (With attachments) (Nance, Robert) (Entered: 07/15/2011)

extracted.value: The MOTION for Summary Judgment was filed by the defendants on July 15, 2011, seeking to have the court grant summary judgment in their favor without a full trial. This motion was later granted by the court.

evidence.text: 07/15/2011 562 MOTION to Dismiss for Lack of Subject Matter Jurisdiction Pursuant to Younger v. Harris by Jay Dee Chase, Richard L DeVaughn, Steven Dow, Howard H Hendrick, Michael L Peck, Ann M Roberts, Linda English Weeks, Aneta F Wilkinson, George E Young, Sr (With attachments) (Gentry, Dorothy) (Entered: 07/15/2011)

extracted.value: The MOTION to Dismiss for Lack of Subject Matter Jurisdiction Pursuant to Younger v. Harris was filed by the defendants on July 15, 2011, seeking to have the court dismiss the case due to lack of jurisdiction under the Younger doctrine. This motion was later denied by the court.

evidence.text: 07/15/2011 558 MOTION Decertification by Jay Dee Chase, Richard L DeVaughn, Steven Dow, Howard H Hendrick, Michael L Peck, Ann M Roberts, Linda English Weeks, Aneta F Wilkinson, George E Young, Sr (With attachments) (Bingham, Donald) (Entered: 07/15/2011)

extracted.value: The MOTION Decertification was filed by the defendants on July 15, 2011, seeking to decertify the class action status. This motion was later opposed by the plaintiffs.
